definitions.definition: bring up and care for (a child) until they are fully grown, especially in a particular manner or place.
examples: he was born and reared in New York City
synonyms: parent; Morehand-rear; educate "I was reared on a farm"

definitions.definition: (of an animal) care for (its young) until they are fully grown.

examples: the calves are reared for beef

definitions.definition: (of a horse or other animal) raise itself upright on its hind legs.
(of a building, mountain, etc.) extend or appear to extend to a great height.
examples: houses reared up on either side
synonyms: loom "Mount Logan reared up before them"

definitions.definition: (of a person) show anger or irritation; go on the attack.
examples: the press reared up in the wake of the bombings
